entities.name: hogsmeade
entities.description: Hogsmeade is a location mentioned in the text as the setting for a weekend trip. It is described as a place where students go to have fun.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a person mentioned in the text as one of Harry's friends. He is quoted as saying 'What's he want to know ab out the next Hogsmeade weekend for?'

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a person mentioned in the text as one of Ron's friends. He is quoted as saying 'Dunno' and is described as having momentary happiness at the sight of an owl.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is a person mentioned in the text as a teacher who has been continuing Professor Grubbly-Plank's lessons on unicorns. He is described as trying to prove he can do anything that Professor Grubbly-Plank could.

entities.name: blast-ended skrewts
entities.description: Blast-Ended Skrewts are creatures mentioned in the text as being taught by Hagrid. They are described as having only two left.

entities.name: unicorns
entities.description: Unicorns are creatures mentioned in the text as being taught by Hagrid. They are described as having no poisonous fangs, which is disappointing to Hagrid.

entities.name: parvati
entities.description: Parvati is a person mentioned in the text as one of Harry's friends. She and Lavender go into transports of delight at the sight of two unicorn foals.

entities.name: lavender
entities.description: Lavender is a person mentioned in the text as one of Harry's friends. She and Parvati go into transports of delight at the sight of two unicorn foals.

entities.name: pansy
entities.description: Pansy is a person mentioned in the text as one of Harry's friends. She is described as going into transports of delight at the sight of two unicorn foals.

entities.name: professor grubbly-plank
entities.description: Professor Grubbly-Plank is a person mentioned in the text as having taught lessons on unicorns. Hagrid continues her lessons after she leaves.

relationships.description: Hagrid continues the work of Professor Grubbly-Plank by continuing her lessons on unicorns.
Hagrid teaches lessons on unicorns, which he continues from Professor Grubbly-Plank's work.
Parvati is delighted by the sight of two unicorn foals, which are pure gold and unlike full-grown unicorns.
Lavender is delighted by the sight of two unicorn foals, which are pure gold and unlike full-grown unicorns.
Pansy is delighted by the sight of two unicorn foals, which are pure gold and unlike full-grown unicorns.
